sub_topic: Determining the solubility of a substance in a solvent
message_1: What is the maximum amount of NaCl that can dissolve in 100 mL of water at 25°C, given that the solubility of NaCl in water is 36 g/100 mL at this temperature?
message_2: The maximum amount of NaCl that can dissolve in 100 mL of water at 25°C is 36 grams, as the solubility of NaCl in water at this temperature is 36 g/100 mL.
